name: Going to the Grocery Store (A)
description: You need to buy food for the week.
You make a shopping list with common items.
At the store, you ask for help finding products.
You talk to the cashier and pay for your items.
You pack your groceries and leave the store.

name: Taking a Bus (A)
description: You wait at the bus stop with other people.
You check the route and timetable before boarding.
You ask the driver where the bus is going.
You find a seat and listen to announcements.
You press the button to stop at your destination.

name: Going to the Doctor (A)
description: You feel sick and book an appointment.
You tell the doctor about your symptoms.
The doctor checks your temperature and heartbeat.
You receive advice and maybe a prescription.
You thank the doctor and leave the clinic.

name: Watching a Movie at the Cinema (A)
description: You choose a film and buy a ticket online or at the counter.
You buy popcorn and a drink before going in.
You find your seat and wait for the movie to start.
You enjoy the movie with other people.
You talk about the movie afterward with friends.

name: Attending a Concert (A)
description: You buy a ticket to see your favorite band.
You arrive early to get a good spot.
You sing along and enjoy the music.
You take pictures and videos of the event.
You leave with great memories of the night.

name: Visiting the Library (A)
description: You go to borrow or return a book.
You use your library card to check out books.
You sit and read quietly in a study area.
You ask a librarian for help finding a book.
You return the book on time to avoid a fine.

name: Visiting a local museum
description: You decide to visit a nearby museum on a weekend.
You buy a ticket at the entrance and grab a map.
You walk through exhibitions of local history and art.
You ask questions to the guide about certain artifacts.
You spend a few hours there and stop by the souvenir shop.

name: Debating environmental policies
description: You join a discussion about recent climate policy proposals.
Participants bring different perspectives and data.
You contribute by questioning current regulations.
You compare policies from other countries.
You summarize the discussion in a follow-up blog post.

name: Booking a hotel room
description: You need to book a hotel for your upcoming trip.
You call the hotel and ask about availability and rates.
You ask about amenities like breakfast and Wi-Fi.
You reserve a double room for three nights.
You receive a confirmation email after the call.

name: Negotiating a job offer
description: You receive a job offer from a company you've interviewed with.
You discuss salary expectations with HR.
You ask about career development and training opportunities.
You bring up relocation costs and work-life balance.
You reach an agreement and sign the contract.

name: Going to a pharmacy
description: You feel unwell and go to the local pharmacy.
You explain your symptoms to the pharmacist.
The pharmacist recommends some over-the-counter medicine.
You also ask about any side effects.
You pay and follow the instructions on the label.

name: Writing a formal complaint
description: You experienced poor service at a restaurant.
You decide to write a formal complaint email to management.
You explain the issue clearly and politely.
You include dates, names, and what you expect as a resolution.
You receive an apology and a voucher for your next visit.

name: Getting a haircut
description: You visit a nearby salon to get a haircut.
You explain the style you want to the hairdresser.
You chat while the haircut is happening.
You ask about products for your hair type.
You tip and thank the stylist before leaving.

name: Discussing a book in a reading group
description: You're part of a monthly reading club.
This week’s book deals with complex social issues.
You prepare comments on character development and plot.
During the session, you analyze metaphors and symbolism.
You suggest a related book for next month.

name: Attending a community event
description: You hear about a cultural event at the local community center.
You invite a friend and go together.
There are performances, food stalls, and local crafts.
You interact with locals and learn about their traditions.
You enjoy live music and take photos.

name: Participating in a panel interview
description: You’re invited to a final round panel interview.
Multiple interviewers ask about technical and soft skills.
You explain your project experience with examples.
You respond to hypothetical situations with confidence.
You thank the panel and follow up via email.
